channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Dozen of large potholes, 12th March
item.description:
The potholes have been identified by a white mark but no further action taken . The holes have increased in size and numbers. The holes to Acorn house were done, poorly at that, but then they always are for some unexplained reason.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Coberley
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Very deep pothole just after junction after rugby club, 12th March
item.description:
Very deep pothole. Seems to be more than one layer deep. It is on the curb side as you drive out of Bishops Cleeve towards Stoke Orchard. I think it is just after the wide junction after the rugby club. But it is on that stretch.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Stoke Road, Bishops Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tyres Flytipped on side of Road, 12th March
item.description:
The location is the road from Aggs Hill that goes into the Cotswold Way part and just short of the Burnt Oak Crossroads. The tip is on the right hand side approx 15 yards from the crossroads. Please can the tyres be removed as son as possible.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road Surface Condition, 11th March
item.description:
Please can you inspect the road condition of Hayden Lane in Staverton as I have received a complaint from a member of the public. The depth of the potholes is causing punctures to vehicles due to the depth. This was previously reported several months ago.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 2 Hayden Lane, Staverton
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: White tag on wall, 11th March
item.description:
On non-railway side
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Carlton Place, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large, deep pothole, 11th March
item.description:
Large dangerous pothole in road, lots of debris now being pushed out of it and spread across the road. Difficult to see how deep when full of rainwater.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 46 Whittington Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 2 drains blocked, 11th March
item.description:
Both drains at the top of the road leading to the bridge on innsworth Lane (technology park/innsworth side) blocked and have been for several months. The other drains are also in need of cleaning due to large amount of silt in them. There is also a manhole cover on the pavement near the top which also overflows during heavy rain which probably needs investigating.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Innsworth Lane, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Unlevel road, 10th March
item.description:
Road un-finished after New estate was built in coopers edge. Road has been finished for quite some time. I've lived here over a year and the road still isn't finished and leveled off. Not great for car tyres. Problem is nearer the roundabout on Buccaneer avenue and past Hitcote Road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 3 Buccaneer Avenue, Brockworth
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Two very large potholes near the juction of Princess Elizabeth Way and Marsland road., 10th March
item.description:
There are two large potholes in Marsland road, near the junction with Princess Elizabeth way (GL510GY), one is approximately 18 inches across and the other 16 and are 2 to 3 inches deep that I couldn't avoid as I drove into Marsland road today and there was a massive bang at the front and rear of my car as I drove into the holes. My car is a Honda Jazz with standard factory fitted suspension, wheels and the tyres have the correct pressures. I was driving no more than 10 miles per hour. It looks like the holes have been marked previously, so either they haven't been repaired previously or need repairing again.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Marsland Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Many potholes along this road, 10th March
item.description:
Potholes of varying sizes but many of them have potential to damage tyres
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 2 Andover Court Andover Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A number of potholes along this road, 10th March
item.description:
There are several potholes, varying in size, along this road - they are difficult to avoid and I got one of them with a considerable thump even though I was doing only 15mph.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): John Dower House Crescent Place, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
